Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Cohabitation \Co*hab"i*ta"tion\, n. [L. cohabitatio.] 1. The act or state of dwelling together, or in the same place with another. --Feltham. [1913 Webster]
2. (Law) The living together of a man and woman in supposed sexual relationship. [1913 Webster]
That the duty of cohabitation is released by the cruelty of one of the parties is admitted. --Lord Stowell. [1913 Webster]
cohabitation n : living together (as spouses) [syn: {living together}]
